intro: Nesaea pusilla var. minima, commonly known as the dwarf nesaea, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, umbellate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, attracting pollinators such as bees. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens as a decorative plant.
